intro: Bulga japonica, commonly known as the Japanese bulbous plant, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its bulbous root system. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
